10.13.text:
I'm a DJ, producer and NTS
Radio presenter from London.

14.60.text:
I've lived here my whole life and I love
this city, but things seem to be changing.

19.26.text:
Last year, a massive 323,000
people emigrated from Britain,

23.73.text:
and with spiralling costs of living contrasting
with better quality of life elsewhere,

32.81.text:
two cities which have burgeoning
music and art scenes.

35.66.text:
I want to see whether they can offer me
the same kind of life as London does,

39.20.text: but in a more affordable way.

41.14.text:
Will I ever relocate
there permenantly?

52.05.text:
The first time I came to Lisbon
was earlier this year,

54.70.text: when I came out to DJ at a party.

57.12.text:
It was so much fun and
everyone was dancing so hard,

60.58.text:
that my first initial experience
was so amazing,

64.37.text: and it made me just want to come back.

67.50.text:
Lisbon is the capital of Portugal,
with a population of around half a million people.

72.12.text:
It happens to be one of Western
Europe's poorest cities.

75.65.text:
The motley nature of the architecture
around the city gives you a sense of

80.68.text: how rich the history of this country is.

84.12.text:
You can tell that once it was
a great imperial power,

87.63.text:
and when it all comes together, punctuate
it with all palm trees and nice hills

92.18.text:
and the sunshine, it definitely feels
like you're not in Europe,

96.40.text:
and it's only 2-3 hours away from
London by plane.

101.96.text:
I've been in touch with Bucki,
who's recently moved over from London.

105.46.text:
She runs her own online fashion store,
and I wanted to ask her some questions

109.46.text:
to get a feel of how it's
working out for her.

112.35.text: What's it been like so far here?

113.92.text:
It's a slower pace even
right in the centre,

116.34.text: it's not as hectic and busy

118.54.text: And how's it been with your work?

119.68.text:
You know, I've been doing this
for a little while now,

122.14.text:
became quite established in London, so
it's going back to working on my own,

125.97.text:
which is different, you know, I feel
like I've gone back to square one.

129.44.text: in a certain... to a certain degree.

131.22.text:
So, when you compare your living
and working costs out in London,

137.15.text:
I was paying almost triple for a room
in a tiny little flat, you know?

141.67.text: Yeah, it's a huge, huge benefit.

144.17.text: And have you got any tips or advice?

146.33.text:
One of the advantages of being here
is obviously the low cost of living,

149.14.text:
but the economy is down
here, so getting a job,

152.67.text:
especially if you don't
speak the language,

154.25.text: is going to be seriously tough.

155.74.text:
You have to have a plan,
financially, I'd say,

159.91.text:
Most of the stuff you do is online,
so I guess the internet makes things easier,

165.45.text:
I can pack up my laptop with
the most amazing view.

169.62.text:
Apart from the sourcing and the
photography side,

176.99.text:
It's been really nice to hang
out with Bucki here,

179.21.text:
and see what her life's like
adjusting to Lisbon.

181.73.text:
I'm not sure it's the right
place for me yet,

183.95.text:
but I've only
scratched the surface,

185.47.text:
and I've got quite a few other
things lined up.

190.89.text:
Since I last came here, I've been
obsessed with Batida Sound.

194.00.text:
It's a musical subculture that
draws on Portgual's African heritage.

198.07.text:
There are some cool artists, like
DJ Marfox, DJ Nervoso, and DJ Firmeza,

202.54.text:
who are fusing African sounds with
European house and techno

209.46.text:
It's a kind of scene that makes me
think I could definitely move here,

211.90.text:
and still get recognition for
what I do.

215.59.text:
I just got a call from DJ Marfox, who's
one my favourite producers right now.

220.10.text:
He's up for meeting for a chat, he said
he's going to show me around his area,

225.20.text:
which is a suburb called
Quinta do Mocho,

227.44.text:
which I've heard from the fixers
isn't the safest area...

230.88.text:
but I'm sure being with him,
we'll be fine.

238.67.text:
It seems like there's quite a good
feeling around here, you know, like,

244.57.text: Life for people now is getting better.

253.99.text:
I still can't believe that I'm sitting
here with you, DJ Marfox

258.76.text: because honestly, I'm such a big fan.

261.25.text: How do you feel about becoming

266.12.text:
I feel privileged to share this music
and this experience with people.

270.55.text:
Do you need to be here for you music, or
can you ever imagine living somewhere else?

275.40.text:
Here I have the privilege to hear
new things nearly every day.

278.58.text:
Like with Nigga Fox. He's a friend
of mine, he lives in Lumiar.

283.61.text: It's a 10 minute drive from here.

287.45.text: And his music is completely different.

290.00.text:
Blacksea Não Maya, he lives south,
it's a 30 minute drive.

292.77.text: But the music is completely different.

294.42.text:
So that's the proof I don't need to go anywhere
else to listen to different things.

299.18.text: Change is happening here, in Lisbon.

302.68.text:
I have never seen this anywhere
else. It's fantastic.

308.89.text:
I've definitely learnt a lot from him
today just from a few hours

312.89.text:
And then also seeing him at work
in the studio as well,

322.50.text:
It turns out Marfox's friend, DJ Firmeza,
is playing a show tonight,

326.02.text:
at an incredible old palace
in the centre of town.

329.24.text:
We're going to meet up so I can check
out what the city is like after dark,

333.53.text:
and later, I'm going to try and find out
more about Lisbon's art scene.
